intro: Hieracium caesium subsp. peralbidum, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are yellow to white in color, with the ray florets often appearing pale or white, giving it a distinctive appearance. The subspecies is distinguished by its reduced or absent bracts and its pale floral coloration compared to other members of the species.
